TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content: In the configs, how do you disable the blackening after losing ablator (specifically for the Gemini pod parts)? I use them on stations but tweak out the ablator. They look horrid that way...

In the configs, how do you disable the blackening after losing ablator (specifically for the Gemini pod parts)? I use them on stations but tweak out the ablator. They look horrid that way...

Add these values to ModuleAblator 


	MODULE
	{
		charMin = 1.0
		charMax = 1.0
	}

Thanks a lot for all your guys' work on this MOD. I am very much enjoying it but i have a question. Am I doing something wrong? The rockets seem to be WAY overpowered. I am getting a soyuz type rocket into orbit in almost a single stage, which is to say i am separating the boosters right before reaching APO. In this design i have also removed the usual SOYUZ 3rd stage. With a PROTON type rocket, I AM getting to orbit with about 5% fuel remaining in the 1st stage!!!

Thanks a lot for all your guys' work on this MOD. I am very much enjoying it but i have a question. Am I doing something wrong? The rockets seem to be WAY overpowered. I am getting a soyuz type rocket into orbit in almost a single stage, which is to say i am separating the boosters right before reaching APO. In this design i have also removed the usual SOYUZ 3rd stage. With a PROTON type rocket, I AM getting to orbit with about 5% fuel remaining in the 1st stage!!!

Fundamentally, Kerbin is not Earth, so this cannot be totally avoided.

The rockets are scaled (fuel and weight) to stock parts (or at least they are intended to be), so they cannot match real-world performance without being artificially nerfed.

You could just copy zzz and put it out there as a seperate down load similar to your texture repo. If someone has a nutty idea they want to try they'd rather a discrete download so no one will never know if things don't work out

Not a bad idea!

Edited November 1, 2015 by Beale

Thanks a lot for all your guys' work on this MOD. I am very much enjoying it but i have a question. Am I doing something wrong? The rockets seem to be WAY overpowered. I am getting a soyuz type rocket into orbit in almost a single stage, which is to say i am separating the boosters right before reaching APO. In this design i have also removed the usual SOYUZ 3rd stage. With a PROTON type rocket, I AM getting to orbit with about 5% fuel remaining in the 1st stage!!!

You are right,

all TantaresLV Engines was overpowered but the Proton is build to lift 20 tons. I have made a new calculation for all Tantares Engines and will bring this as patch in the next week. This Patch is only for stock KSP with stock physics.

With this patch the following Rockets made:

ALV ~ Proton lift 21 tons in a safe orbit with max 170km

TLV ~ Sojus/Soyuz lift 6 tons in a safe orbit with max 150km

A thought what if a lifter was made "stubby"? probably material for a separate pack but would a soyuz rocket half the height of the "to-scale" one get more reasonable performance in the stock scale solar system?
Now all we need to figure out is how to launch a 5m diameter capsule on top of a 3.75m N-I, eh Beale?

Easy swap everything above the first stage out for a nuclear based second stage there were concepts studied if I recall correctly

Well, that might actually work... I'd vote for a big-ass hydrolox stage, however.

You are right,

all TantaresLV Engines was overpowered but the Proton is build to lift 20 tons. I have made a new calculation for all Tantares Engines and will bring this as patch in the next week. This Patch is only for stock KSP with stock physics.

With this patch the following Rockets made:

ALV ~ Proton lift 21 tons in a safe orbit with max 170km

TLV ~ Sojus/Soyuz lift 6 tons in a safe orbit with max 150km

Aren't 170 km and 150 km insufficient? I mean, that's a pretty low altitude: on 160 km you can use higher timewarp, and after 200 km overall performance improves because of planet rendering

Easy swap everything above the first stage out for a nuclear based second stage there were concepts studied if I recall correctly

I vote for a UR-700

I don't think that fattening the third stage is needed, just stick the third stage inside a fairing!

What sort of sizes do the launch vehicle engines come in?

I've been using the main Tantares pack (which is truly beautiful work, btw) for orbiters/stations/etc for a while now, but making my launch vehicles from stock, procedural parts, and SXT mainly, but after having scaled up my R-7 design (with the help of these schematics) none of my engines are the right size any more. 1.875m-2m engines seem to be what I mainly need at the minute. Is the LV pack the solution?

I don't think that fattening the third stage is needed, just stick the third stage inside a fairing!

How this would work? I don't quite understand.

What sort of sizes do the launch vehicle engines come in?

I've been using the main Tantares pack (which is truly beautiful work, btw) for orbiters/stations/etc for a while now, but making my launch vehicles from stock, procedural parts, and SXT mainly, but after having scaled up my R-7 design (with the help of these schematics) none of my engines are the right size any more. 1.875m-2m engines seem to be what I mainly need at the minute. Is the LV pack the solution?

The Launchers pack is not needed 100%

But, for launch vehicles I use these sizes for their general diameter (they are not 100% to correct IRL scale, far from it).

SOYUZ FG - 1.25m

PROTON - 2.5m

ARIANE V - 3.75m (This one is very far off).

N-I - Identical, more or less, to SXT sizing (Because Lack made the models ).

More pictures - quite big.

I will try to be more considerate from now on when posting large image dumps.

It's a bulky heatshield, but it is built to withstand (at least that is the excuse). It acts as the decoupler also.

Heatshield Fairing.

Actually I made a mistake with the heatshield slope, it is 2 degrees off. Will be fixed.
